alert.note: Alert for Chuska Mountains; Far Northwest Highlands; Jemez Mountains; Northern Sangre de Cristo Mountains; Tusas Mountains Including Chama (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued February 23 at 10:37PM MST until February 24 at 5:00AM MST by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 5 AM MST THURSDAY... * WHAT...Heavy snow. Additional snow accumulations of 4 to 6 inches, except 6 to 10 inches on west facing slopes above 9,500 feet. * WHERE...Far Northwest Highlands, Jemez Mountains, Northern Sangre de Cristo Mountains, Tusas Mountains Including Chama and Chuska Mountains. * WHEN...Until 5 AM MST Thursday. * IMPACTS...Roads, and especially bridges and overpasses, will likely become slick and hazardous. Travel could be very difficult. Tire traction will be reduced. Extend the distance between your vehicle and the vehicle in front of you.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. For the latest road conditions, dial 511 or 1.800.432.4269, or visit http://nmroads.com.

area.areaDesc: Chuska Mountains; Far Northwest Highlands; Jemez Mountains; Northern Sangre de Cristo Mountains; Tusas Mountains Including Chama
